name: 施陽正
objective: The objective of this course is to introduce the engineering application of Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD). Based upon the method of CFD and fast calculation ability of computers, students can solve related problems in the fields of energy, refrigeration and air-conditioning, and thermofluid sciences. The main content of this course includes "Introduction to CFD", "Foundation of thermofluid governing equations", "Turbulent models", "Introduction to finite difference method", "Introduction to finite volume method", "Application of package software", and "Case study".
schedule:
1.　　Course Outline & Introduction to CFD (1 week)
2.　　Governing Equations (2 weeks)
3.　　Introduction to Finite-Difference Method (2 weeks)
4.　　Introduction to Finite-Volume Method (3 weeks)
5.　　Introduction to Turbulence Modeling (2 weeks)
6.　　Introduction to ANSYS FLUENT (3 weeks)
7.　　Solving CFD with ANSYS FLUENT (4 weeks)
materials:
1. Versteeg, H.K, W. Malalasekera (2007), An Introduction to Computational Fluid Dynamics---The Finite Volume Method. (www.amazon.com).
2. Patankar, S.V. (1980), Numerical Heat Transfer and Fluid Flow. 
3. Anderson, D.A., J.C. Tannehill, R.H. Pletcher (1984,1997), Computational Fluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer, 1984 ed., 1997ed.
